items.sentence: Tom wasn't the only one who looked tired. Mary looked tired, too.
What time of year do you usually like to spend time on the beach?
What'll you do if you can't find enough food to feed your family?
Tom speaks to his family in French and to his friends in English.
I'm tired. I just want to go on the teacup ride and take it easy.
A clerk in the office is only a pawn in the game of big business.
I'm stuck in a rut in my boring job and need to do something new.
Tom didn't find out he was adopted until he was thirty years old.
Tom wanted to keep walking, but Mary insisted they stop and rest.
I've never done this before. Could you please show me what to do?
The government isn't doing its best to solve the housing problem.
I plan to go to Australia whether Tom wants to go with me or not.
I don't think that Tom wants to spend any more time in Australia.
I've been thinking it might be fun to go to Boston and visit Tom.
Tom said he knew Mary's brother wanted to go to Boston with them.
I don't think that I'd be able to convince Tom to do that for us.
I suspect that Tom knows that he isn't supposed to be doing that.
Tom began to suspect Mary was planning a surprise birthday party.
I suspect that Tom and Mary were planning on doing that tomorrow.
I wonder whether or not there's any possibility Tom will do that.
